tail off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to become gradually less, smaller etc, and often stop or disappear completely
tail off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Profits tailed off towards the end of the year.
tail off.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if someone’s voice tails off, it becomes quieter and then stops
tail off.translation[0].definitions[1].e: ‘I didn’t mean ...’ Her voice tailed off in embarrassment.
